class.name: Word.Body
class.description: Represents the body of a document or a section.

properties.name: contentControls
properties.description: Gets the collection of rich text content control objects in the body.

examples.description: Find all content controls in the document body and highlight them by setting their background color to yellow.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a document body to verify the add-in is properly connected to the Word host application

properties.name: endnotes
properties.description: Gets the collection of endnotes in the body.

examples.description: Get all endnotes from the document body and display the count and text of each endnote in the console.

properties.name: fields
properties.description: Gets the collection of field objects in the body.

examples.description: Retrieve and display all fields in the document body, showing their code and result values, or indicate if no fields exist.

properties.name: font
properties.description: Gets the text format of the body. Use this to get and set font name, size, color and other properties.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the font size, font name, font color, and style properties of the document body.

properties.name: footnotes
properties.description: Gets the collection of footnotes in the body.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the total count of footnotes present in the document body.

properties.name: inlinePictures
properties.description: Gets the collection of InlinePicture objects in the body. The collection doesn't include floating images.

examples.description: Retrieve the first inline picture from the document body and log its dimensions, format, and Base64-encoded image data.

properties.name: lists
properties.description: Gets the collection of list objects in the body.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the level types and level existences information for the first list in the document body.

properties.name: paragraphs
properties.description: Gets the collection of paragraph objects in the body.

examples.description: Count the number of occurrences of each unique word in the document and display the results.

properties.name: parentBody
properties.description: Gets the parent body of the body. For example, a table cell body's parent body could be a header. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if there isn't a parent body.

examples.description: Get the parent body of a table cell and highlight it in yellow to show the relationship between nested body elements.

properties.name: parentBodyOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the parent body of the body. For example, a table cell body's parent body could be a header. If there isn't a parent body, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

examples.description: Check if the current body has a parent body and highlight the parent body in yellow if it exists (useful for identifying whether content is nested within a table cell, text box, or other container).

properties.name: parentContentControl
properties.description: Gets the content control that contains the body. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if there isn't a parent content control.

examples.description: Check if the document body is inside a content control and highlight the parent content control in yellow if it exists.

properties.name: parentContentControlOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the content control that contains the body. If there isn't a parent content control, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

examples.description: Check if the document body is inside a content control, and if so, change the content control's title to "Document Container"

properties.name: parentSection
properties.description: Gets the parent section of the body. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if there isn't a parent section.

examples.description: Get the header text from the parent section of the document body and display it in the console.

properties.name: parentSectionOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the parent section of the body. If there isn't a parent section, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

examples.description: Check if the body belongs to a section and display the section's header text, or show a message if there is no parent section (e.g., for the main document body).

properties.name: shapes
properties.description: Gets the collection of shape objects in the body, including both inline and floating shapes. Currently, only the following shapes are supported: text boxes, geometric shapes, groups, pictures, and canvases.

examples.description: Retrieve all shapes from the document body and log the properties of each shape that is a text box to the console.

properties.name: style
properties.description: Specifies the style name for the body. Use this property for custom styles and localized style names. To use the built-in styles that are portable between locales, see the "styleBuiltIn" property.

examples.description: Set the document body to use a custom style named "MyCustomBodyStyle"

properties.name: styleBuiltIn
properties.description: Specifies the built-in style name for the body. Use this property for built-in styles that are portable between locales. To use custom styles or localized style names, see the "style" property.

examples.description: Apply the "Title" built-in style to the document body to format all body content with the Title style

properties.name: tables
properties.description: Gets the collection of table objects in the body.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the text content from the first cell of the first table in the document.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Gets the text of the body. Use the insertText method to insert text.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the plain text content of the document body in the console.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Gets the type of the body. The type can be 'MainDoc', 'Section', 'Header', 'Footer', or 'TableCell'. Additional types âFootnoteâ, âEndnoteâ, and âNoteItemâ are supported in WordAPIOnline 1.1 and later.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the item type and body type of a specific footnote in the document based on a user-provided reference number.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears the contents of the body object. The user can perform the undo operation on the cleared content.

examples.description: Remove all content from the document body.

methods.name: getComments
methods.description: Gets comments associated with the body.

examples.description: Retrieve all comments from the document body and display them in the console.

methods.name: getContentControls
methods.description: Gets the currently supported content controls in the body.

examples.description: Get all content controls in the document body and display their titles in the console

methods.name: getHtml
methods.description: Gets an HTML representation of the body object. When rendered in a web page or HTML viewer, the formatting will be a close, but not exact, match for of the formatting of the document. This method doesn't return the exact same HTML for the same document on different platforms (Windows, Mac, Word on the web, etc.). If you need exact fidelity, or consistency across platforms, use `Body.getOoxml()` and convert the returned XML to HTML.

examples.description: Retrieve the HTML representation of the document body and display it in the console.

methods.name: getOoxml
methods.description: Gets the OOXML (Office Open XML) representation of the body object.

examples.description: Retrieve the OOXML representation of the document body and output it to the console.

methods.name: getRange
methods.description: Gets the whole body, or the starting or ending point of the body, as a range.

examples.description: Highlight the entire document body with yellow color to mark it for review

methods.name: getReviewedText
methods.description: Gets reviewed text based on ChangeTrackingVersion selection.

examples.description: Get and display the original text of a document before any tracked changes were applied

methods.name: getTrackedChanges
methods.description: Gets the collection of the TrackedChange objects in the body.

examples.description: Retrieve all tracked changes from the document body and log them to the console.

methods.name: insertBreak
methods.description: Inserts a break at the specified location in the main document.

examples.description: Insert a page break at the beginning of the document body.

methods.name: insertContentControl
methods.description: Wraps the Body object with a content control.

examples.description: Wrap the entire document body in a content control.

methods.name: insertFileFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts a document into the body at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert the contents of an external Word document (provided as a Base64-encoded string) at the beginning of the current document's body.

methods.name: insertHtml
methods.description: Inserts HTML at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert HTML content containing bold text at the beginning of the document body.

methods.name: insertInlinePictureFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts a picture into the body at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert a Base64-encoded inline picture at the beginning of the document body.

methods.name: insertOoxml
methods.description: Inserts OOXML at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert formatted text with custom font size, color, line spacing, and paragraph spacing at the beginning of the document body using OOXML.

methods.name: insertParagraph
methods.description: Inserts a paragraph at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert a paragraph with custom text at the end of the document body and format it with italic, blue, 30-point Berlin Sans FB font.

methods.name: insertTable
methods.description: Inserts a table with the specified number of rows and columns.

examples.description: Insert a 2x3 table at the start of the document body with city and fruit data, apply the Grid Table 5 Dark - Accent 2 style, and disable first column formatting.

methods.name: insertText
methods.description: Inserts text into the body at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert text at the beginning of the document body.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call `context.sync()` before reading the properties.

examples.description: Load and display the text content from the document body

methods.name: search
methods.description: Performs a search with the specified SearchOptions on the scope of the body object. The search results are a collection of range objects.

examples.description: Search for text in the document body using basic text matching or wildcard patterns and highlight all matching results.

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects the body and navigates the Word UI to it.

examples.description: Select the entire document body and move the Word UI focus to it.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

examples.description: Configure multiple body properties at once to set the style and alignment for the document body

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript `toJSON()` method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to `JSON.stringify()`. (`JSON.stringify`, in turn, calls the `toJSON` method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original `Word.Body` object is an API object, the `toJSON` method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as `Word.Interfaces.BodyData`) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize the document body properties to JSON format for logging or data transfer purposes

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across `.sync` calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a document body object to maintain its reference across multiple sync calls when modifying its properties in separate operations

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call `context.sync()` before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Get the document body text and then untrack the body object to free memory after use
